author: Special Correspondent
text:
After a long wait, the Passport Seva Kendra of the Ministry of External Affairs at Puducherry is finally set to commence operations later this month.

Mini Passport Seva Kendra to begin functioning

“As we were focussing on the flood-related work, we could not commence our Puducherry operations in December last year. But, we are certain that before the end of this month, the mini Passport Seva Kendra (PSK) would start functioning in the Puducherry,” Regional Passport Officer K. Balamurugan informed.

The mini PSK would function in the Animal Husbandry Department complex near the Puducherry Bus Stand. Once the mini PSK becomes functional, it would not only benefit applicants from the Union Territory of Puducherry but also the neighbouring Cuddalore and Villupuram districts of Tamil Nadu.

Applications

The Regional Passport Office in Chennai had processed over 4.10 lakh applications and issued a total of 4,06,300 passports during 2015, the highest by this office. The office had issued 3.90 lakh passports during 2014.
title: Mini PSK at Puducherry to open this month
